repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Programmatic Structural
            Adjustment Credit (PSAC) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Lessons learnt from this operation concerned
            the need for government commitment; recognizing limitations
            and constraints faced by governments; the need for an
            effective communication strategy to develop stakeholder
            consensus; involving downstream/partner implementing
            agencies at an early stage; being realistic in program
            design and implementation; effective design of complex
            actions by laying out the steps clearly and to paying
            attention to their sequence and linkages; the advantages of
            the flexibility of floating tranche design; building crucial
            capacity at an early stage; the importance of involvement of
            the Country Office; improving predictability of resource
            flows; and coordinating with bilaterals and other
            international financial institutions.

Tanzania - Programmatic Structural

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Programmatic Structural
            Adjustment Credit Project : release of the privatization and
            regulation floating tranche - full compliance

abstracts.cdata!:
For the release of the Privatization and
            Regulation floating tranche satisfactory progress in
            implementing the program and maintaining a satisfactory
            macro-economic framework along with the following conditions
            in the areas of privatization and regulation were to be
            fulfilled: establishment of regulatory agencies in the
            utility and transport sectors and enabling legislation;
            approval of a strategy for the privatization of all Tanzania
            Harbors Authority (THA) services and the sale of non-core
            assets, issuing technical regulations under the Petroleum
            Conservation Act of 1981, ensuring the quality and safety of
            petroleum products; approval of a strategy for reorganizing
            Tanzania Electricity Supply Company (TANESCO) and
            restructuring the electricity sector with the objective of
            introducing competition in the generation and distribution
            of electric power; bringing the Tanzania Railways
            Corporation's (TRC) rail services to a point of
            concession/leas; carrying out an audit, property valuation,
            and actuarial study of the National Insurance Corporation
            (NIC),and approval of a strategy for the divestiture of NIC;
            and developing and approval of  options for divesting or
            liquidating  the remaining cashew nut processing plants,
            NARCO (National Ranching Corporation)  ranches, and NAFCO
            (National Food Corporation) wheat, rice and maize farms.
            This report finds that overall performance and progress with
            the implementation of the program supported by the Credit to
            be satisfactory, and the Borrower to be in compliance with
            the specific conditions of release referred in paragraph (d)
            of Section 2.02 and listed in Part 4 of Schedule 2 of the
            Credit Agreement. Consequently the International Development
            Association has informed the Borrower of the availability of
            the Privatization and Regulation floating tranche in the
            equivalent of SDR 29.85 million.
